page.title: 14Clay Cross Works
page.content: { Clay Cross Works'}only competitor for clean water pipes in Britain is Stanton and Staveley.The Works used to make gas pipes as well until a new plastic pipe was developed.They buy the coke from the cheapest supplier. This is usually local, such as{Coalite at{Bolsover. One of the main materials needed for making the pipes is {steel {scrap.}They first melt the scrap and pour it into a mould and spin it.The faster the speed, the thinner the pipe is.The Works buy the scrap from scrap merchants mainly in South Yorkshire and Norh Derbyshire.Every 12 months the furnaces have to be relined because the inner is burnt out. Recently some surface coal seams that are 1 metre thick are being mined by bulldozers and lorries.
